item.title: Why I'm Learning to Use Vim
item.description: The world is becoming a very complicated place. The rush to make everything bigger and better is creating unnecessarily complicated products. Product managers build feature after feature into products (feature creep) until something that started simple and did something limited extremely well, morphs into a bloated monstrosity that aims to please everybody (or an entirely new user base) leaving the core user base frustrated and yearning for the simplicity of the original product.

item.title: Reboot
item.description: I’ve decided to start blogging again. The “social” web has become a toxic and unhospitable place. Although I quit Facebook years ago, I was still using Twitter. Even before Elon took over, Twitter was already a wasteland with the nuance and civility of a South American soccer stadium, where the extreme left and the extreme right hurl quips and insults to each other 24 hours a day, while everybody else is ignored.
